text: RT @SecWilkie I had a fascinating visit with our staff at @vasaltlakecity today!  They have set a new standard for technology with telehealth pods and their gait/movement clinic. I also appreciate @SenatorRomney joining me today to thank our staff for their dedication to our Veterans. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EkZbPa8WkAEl8qQ.jpg

Joined @SpencerJCox and local Utah leaders today in Millcreek, the site of a recent lightning strike that ignited a wildfire, to introduce my bill to establish a national commission that would study and recommend fire mitigation policies to Congress. https://www.romney.senate.gov/romney-joins-utah-officials-unveil-plan-improve-wildfire-policy

Utah & Western states have faced an unprecedented level of wildland fires this year, due in large part to many decades of poor forest management and a persistent lack of local input. Washington bureaucrats are not the experts when it comes to managing fires, lands, and disasters.

Judge Amy Coney Barrett is exceptionally well qualified to serve on the Supreme Court, and I intend to vote in support of her confirmation. https://www.romney.senate.gov/romney-announces-support-judge-amy-coney-barrett

.@VASaltLakeCity provides services to more than 60,000 veterans across the region. I will be transparent with you about any test results that I do receive. In the meantime, remember: wear a mask, practice social distancing, and wash your hands regularly. It is possible to stop the spread.

Both the crew member and the staff member were wearing N95 masks at all points they were near me, and our doctors believe that we were not exposed under CDC guidelines. Out of an abundance of caution, I will cancel travel through Sunday and continue to campaign virtually.

Late last night, I learned a non-staff flight crew member & a member of my team tested positive for COVID. I wasn’t in close contact—as defined by the CDC—with either during the 2 days prior to their positive tests.

I've had 2 negative tests this week & am not showing symptoms.
